firstRabiesVaccination.name: First rabies vaccination
firstRabiesVaccination.description: Administration of first dose of vaccine product containing only Rabies lyssavirus antigen
firstRabiesVaccination.details: The initial vaccination against rabies, which is crucial for protecting from this deadly viral disease.

secondRabiesVaccination.name: Second rabies vaccination
secondRabiesVaccination.description: Administration of second dose of vaccine product containing only Rabies lyssavirus antigen
secondRabiesVaccination.details: The second vaccination against rabies, which is vital for reinforcing the immunity established by the first dose.

thirdRabiesVaccination.name: Third rabies vaccination
thirdRabiesVaccination.description: Administration of third dose of vaccine product containing only Rabies lyssavirus antigen
thirdRabiesVaccination.details: The third vaccination against rabies, which is important for ensuring continued immunity.

canineLeptospirosisVaccination.name: Immunization for canine leptospirosis
canineLeptospirosisVaccination.description: A vaccine that protects against leptospirosis, a bacterial infection that can affect the liver and kidneys.
canineLeptospirosisVaccination.details: Leptospirosis is zoonotic, meaning it can also be transmitted to humans, making vaccination an essential preventative measure for pets and their owners.

felineLeukemiaVaccination.name: Immunization for feline leukemia
felineLeukemiaVaccination.description: A vaccine designed to protect from feline leukemia virus (FeLV), which can suppress the immune system and lead to severe illnesses.
felineLeukemiaVaccination.details: This immunization is especially important for outdoor or social animals that may come into contact with infected individuals.

bordetellaVaccination.name: Immunization for bordetella
bordetellaVaccination.description: Administration of vaccine product containing Bordetella bronchisepticum antigen
bordetellaVaccination.details: A vaccine to protect against Bordetella bronchiseptica, a common bacterial cause of kennel cough.

lymeVaccination.name: Administration of Lyme disease vaccine
lymeVaccination.description: Administration of vaccine product containing only Borrelia burgdorferi antigen
lymeVaccination.details: A vaccine designed to protect against Borrelia burgdorferi, the bacterium responsible for Lyme disease.

rabiesVaccination.name: Rabies vaccination
rabiesVaccination.description: Administration of vaccine product containing only Rabies lyssavirus antigen
rabiesVaccination.details: A vaccine that protects against rabies, a viral disease that affects the central nervous system.

rabiesBoosterVaccination.name: Rabies booster vaccination
rabiesBoosterVaccination.description: Administration of booster dose of vaccine product containing only Rabies lyssavirus antigen
rabiesBoosterVaccination.details: A booster vaccination that reinforces the protection against rabies.
